thread.title: High Court upholds Kim Dotcom deportation order | Stuff.co.nz
thread.title_full: High Court upholds Kim Dotcom deportation order | Stuff.co.nz

title: High Court upholds Kim Dotcom deportation order | Stuff.co.nz
text:
High Court upholds Kim Dotcom deportation order Last updated 15:43, February 20 2017 Nigel Marple/Reuters 
Kim Dotcom has been battling extradition through the courts. 
The High Court has found that alleged internet pirate Kim Dotcom and his associates are eligible to be extradited to the US. 
In a ruling released on Monday, the court found that the evidence was sufficient to establish a prima facie case on all counts. 
The decision was in response to an appeal by Dotcom and his associates against an earlier district court ruling that they should be surrendered to the US. 
More to come
